item.title: Excerpts of Academic English
item.description: Excerpts Introduction A positive constant determined by $l$ besides $\tau$ (possibly changing from line to line) is henceforth denoted by $C_l$. Here and henceforth, $T_{max}$ denotes the maximal time of the existence of the solution, and $|\cdot|_p$ is the standard $L_p$ norm Deduction differentiating (1.4) with respect to time gives Similarity At this stage, we can reproduce the argument of [20]. The proof is done along a similar line, but estimates near the boundary are more crucial.
